definition.title: Crafting Your Perfect Biography
definition.subtitle: Your professional biography is an essential marketing tool that combines your Authority Hook and Impact Intro into a comprehensive narrative. A powerful biography communicates your credibility, expertise, results, and mission in a way that connects with your audience.
definition.content: A professional biography is a concise summary of your career, expertise, and achievements written to establish credibility with your target audience. Unlike a resume, a bio tells your story in a way that connects with readers and positions you as an authority in your field.

landingContent.formula: I help [WHO] achieve [RESULT] when [WHEN] through [HOW]. I've [WHERE]. My mission is to [WHY].
tips: Start with your Authority Hook - clearly identify WHO you help and WHAT results you deliver
Include specific, quantifiable achievements rather than vague claims
Connect your work to a larger purpose or mission
Short bio (50-75 words) for social; Medium (100-150) for speaker intros; Long (200-300) for detailed profiles

Through my proven systems, I've guided over 200 business owners to achieve 6-figure growth while working fewer hours. My mission is to prove that business success and personal fulfillment aren't mutually exclusive.

faq.question: What information should I include?
faq.answer: Include your name, area of expertise, and 2-3 notable achievements. The more specific you are, the better the results.

faq.question: Which point of view should I use?
faq.answer: Third person is standard for professional media kits and speaker profiles. First person works better for personal websites and social media.

faq.question: Can I edit the generated bio?
faq.answer: Absolutely! We recommend reviewing and personalizing all AI-generated content to match your unique voice and verify accuracy.

faq.question: What's the best length for a speaker bio?
faq.answer: Medium (100 words) works well for most speaking applications. Short bios are great for quick intros, while long bios suit detailed media kits.
